thread.title: Draymond Green's 'reverse psychology' led to spat with Kevin Durant, report says
thread.title_full: Draymond Green's 'reverse psychology' led to spat with Kevin Durant, report says

author: Joe Rodgers (joseph.rodgers@peformgroup.com)
title: Draymond Green's 'reverse psychology' led to spat with Kevin Durant, report says
text:
NBA February 7, 2017 7:18pm EST February 7, 2017 7:18pm EST Basketball, NBA, News, Golden State Warriors, English, Kevin Durant, Draymond Green Green approached the superstar with a slew of swear words meant to light a fire under Durant. Instead he finished with just 10 points. Draymond Green (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:18 p.m. ET 
Updated at 7:18 p.m. ET 
When Draymond Green and Kevin Durant got into an argument in Saturday's loss to the Kings, it was nothing more than reverse psychology gone wrong. 
During a timeout and with Durant struggling from the field, Green approached his new Warriors teammate with a slew of swear words meant to light a fire under Durant, according to ESPN.com . 
MORE: NBA suspends DeMarcus Cousins one game after 16th technical foul 
"Fâ€” you" was said by both players with Durant leaving the spat enraged, sources told ESPN. But apparently that's exactly what Green had hoped for as he began to wink and smile at some of his teammates and coaching staff after the altercation. 
Durant went 2-for-10 from the field and finished with a season-low 10 points in the loss. 
When asked about the altercation Tuesday, Green told reporters, "It was actually a tactic. But that's for us to know and for everyone else to figure out." 
Warriors coach Steve Kerr also downplayed the altercation. 
"It's totally normal," Kerr told reporters. "You should have seen the Bulls back in the day. ... It's just competitive, heat-of-the-moment stuff." Watch This
